messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Learning Patient Parenting
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, yeah, that too.  I was just assuming that part was included.  ;) -Tracy-
messages.messageBody:
On Jul 20, 2004, at 11:43 AM, eriksmama2001 wrote:

> And celebrate with them when they experience the joy of learning at
> their own pace.


Well, yeah, that too. I was just assuming that part was included. ;)
-Tracy-

messages.subject: Re: Learning Patient Parenting
messages.msgSnippet: And celebrate with them when they experience the joy of learning at their own pace. Pat ... family ... one ... But
messages.messageBody:
And celebrate with them when they experience the joy of learning at
their own pace.

Pat


--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, TreeGoddess
<treegoddess@c...> wrote:
> "If we take our cues from most popular media, or from, say, the
family
> courts, we're told that a good parent is an active parent, a doer,
one
> who spends quality time - instructing, raising, bringing kids up.
But
> what if we didn't bring them up? What if we did nothing but watch?"
>
> A snippet from
> http://www.mothering.com/15-0-0/html/15-7-0/patient-parenting.shtml
>
> -Tracy-
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Learning Patient Parenting
messages.msgSnippet: Tracy I really enjoyed reading this article.  Thank you for sharing it... Tina
messages.messageBody:
Tracy

I really enjoyed reading this article. Thank you for sharing it...

Tina

messages.subject: Learning Patient Parenting
messages.msgSnippet: If we take our cues from most popular media, or from, say, the family courts, we re told that a good parent is an active parent, a doer, one who spends
messages.messageBody:
"If we take our cues from most popular media, or from, say, the family
courts, we're told that a good parent is an active parent, a doer, one
who spends quality time - instructing, raising, bringing kids up. But
what if we didn't bring them up? What if we did nothing but watch?"

A snippet from
http://www.mothering.com/15-0-0/html/15-7-0/patient-parenting.shtml

-Tracy-

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
